intro: Amauropelta gracilis, commonly known as the slender maidenhair fern, is a species of fern native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Pteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with creeping stems that produce new shoots along their length. Its leaves are typically bright green and have a feathery appearance, with a glossy texture. Amauropelta gracilis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
